title: Let's talk about tank meta
body: Now, there are many tanks who can do so much damage with a full tank build such as Pantheon, Cho'gath, Wukong, Sion, Ekko, Darius, Amumu, Malphite, WW, Naut, etc. Some only deal that much damage to squishy and some are just ridicilous with mobility and high damage. Some is annoying support such as Shen, Alistar, etc. Some can even kill squishies, adc's, other tanks with a burst too. Now what do you guys think about this? Let me know. Either is it annoying, broken, OK, does not matter etc. Any opinion I can take.

replies.body: what is the question you're asking for a response to? You've just stated a bunch of facts that are well appreciated.

Tank mains will defend how disgusting this meta is.

Non Tank mains will cry how disgusting this meta is.

no. you're absolutely wrong. perhaps what you meant by "full tank build" is "1-2 damage items into full tank for optimal dueling while also sustaining enough to blow up a squishy if you can catch em out". if you had a team full of these champions verses a team with 3-4 tanks and like a xerath and tristana, these 2 can run amuck against all those low range champs (assuming no summoner spells), poking from afar and dealing consistent autoattack damage or low-cd long range poke. they do their job, but its hard to balance them because if they dont deal enough damage they'll get chipped away to death from decent poking/kiting and then everyone might aswell play 4 adc's, but then adcs will be too strong, so they'll get nerfed and we'll all play zoning long range mages, and so on. every champ that gets released it becomes unfathomably harder for riot to balance them. its impossible for everything to just be perfectly balanced because theres too much variables. but thats what makes it such a unique and interesting game, outside of pro play

the biggest problem is that, with 1-2 damage items into full tank, thats the most obvious and easiest way to snowball and dominate in multiple aspects of the game, such as 1v1ing, or during teamfights when you soak up all the damage while unleashing your combo and you're still possibly alive  for them to have wasted their important cooldowns that you can still dominate and chase em down with your backline
Tank Ekko and Fizz enough said.

In my opinion Tanks should be really damn hard to kill, but struggle to kill anything themselves, where as damage champs ADC/Mage/Assassins should be able to kill things easily, but also be able to be killed easily.

so a 1v1 fight between an adc and a tank, could evenly go either way.

but you put voli or cho'gath etc up against an adc now (adc's (sustained damage) are supposed to be the counter to tanks) an they will wreck the adc in seconds. Thats just wrong.

Why would you balance around 1v1 when it is a team game? If they do that low dmg then only CC/utility tanks would have any worth. Why target the frontline tank who has very little dmg when you can just rush backline and take out the actual threats?

im not basing it around a 1v1, thats an example to show how the damage/tankiness correlate.

youre never supposed to target the frontline tanks?

and non damage high tankiness cc tanks are exactly what I'm saying tanks should be.

But not all "tank" champs have huge CC and their ratios are different. You list Voli, he has only 1 form of throwback hard cc and 1 form of soft CC in a slow. Compare him to Naut who has q , passive, ult and a slow. Thats 1 hard 1 soft compared to 3 hard and 1 soft cc, so why shouldn't Voli do some dmg? His kit has a lot less forms of CC. Cho has only 1 knockup and a silence.


Sure in a 1v1 the tanks can put out decent dmg but with adcs will put out heaps more if positioned and protected correctly. The way dmg/tankiness correlate already exists, although it is apparent some champion kits are loaded a little better than others. This isn't a traditional RPG/MMO and having tanks with only cc and no dmg makes for a very stale meta.

IMO tanks should be doing some dmg, if they are relegated to CC bots with large HP pools then expect an exodus of players from that top lane role ( look at how few people actually enjoy playing supp or really appreciate what players can do from the supp role ). Tanks are much more powerful early-mid game, so I guess the problem is the amount of time it takes for an adc to become relevant and bust through the tanks is much longer coupled with increased death timers and games snowballing to the point where an adc doesn't come online before the game is over. So the lower your rank, the bigger problem you have with tank meta as generally you will acquire gold at a a slower rate and bleed objectives faster.

Are we trying to balance professional play around tanks or are we trying to balance low rank dynamic que around them?
